Text: Sing to the LORD a new song, for He has done marvelous things; His right hand and holy arm have worked salvation for Him.
Context: The psalmist calls for a new song of praise, acknowledging God’s salvation and mighty works.

Text: The LORD has made His salvation known and revealed His righteousness to the nations.
Context: God‘s salvation and righteousness are made visible to all people.

Text: He has remembered His love and faithfulness to Israel; all the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.
Context: God’s faithfulness to Israel is a testament to His unfailing love, which extends to all the earth.

Text: Shout to the LORD, all the earth; break forth in song, rejoice, and sing praises.
Context: The psalmist invites the whole earth to express great joy and praise to the LORD through song.

Text: Sing praises to the LORD with the lyre, with the lyre and the sound of melody.
Context: Musical instruments like the lyre are called to join in the praise of God.

Text: With trumpets and the blast of the ram‘s horn, shout for joy before the LORD, the King.
Context: The use of trumpets and the ram’s horn emphasizes the joyfulness and celebratory nature of the praise to God, the King.

Text: Let the sea resound, and all that fills it, the world, and all who dwell in it.
Context: The psalmist calls for the entire creation, including the sea and its inhabitants, to join in the praise of God.

Text: Let the rivers clap their hands, let the mountains sing together for joy
Context: The psalmist uses poetic imagery, depicting rivers and mountains as participating in the joyful praise of God.

Text: He will judge the world in righteousness and the peoples with equity.
Context: This verse looks forward to God‘s righteous and fair judgment of the world, which is cause for rejoicing.
